intro: Dombeya ivohibeensis, commonly known as the Ivohibeensis Dombeya, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming during the rainy season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
